Name: MVP_Hypothesis_Prioritizer
Purpose: Rank and select the smallest MVP feature set that best tests whether the product reduces overwhelm and increases investment confidence
Deliverables: A probability-weighted list of core hypotheses (e.g., 'guided onboarding reduces drop-off', 'step-based portfolios increase confidence') mapped to candidate MVP features, with posterior belief updates based on expected evidence strength and implementation cost
Strengths: Good at systematically comparing many possible MVP directions, focusing on those that maximize learning about overwhelm reduction and confidence-building per unit of effort
Watch-out: Fails when input priors are arbitrary or biased, or when qualitative factors (e.g., user trust) are not encoded as hypotheses, leading to overconfidence in mis-specified MVP scopes
